title: Question 13
prompt:
Every plant cell has an outer layer, called the cell wall, which gives the cell rigidity and shape. Within the cell wall are parts of the cell that helps it to function properly.

What part of a plant cell allows certain substances to move in and out of the cell?
feedback: A membrane is a selective barrier that allows passage of certain substances. A coffee filter acts like a membrane when it allows liquids to pass, but prevents coffee grounds from passing. Every plant cell has a cell membrane for this purpose. The cell membrane is the layer of the plant cell just under the cell wall.
